$$Component_Title: A human readable name for the component.
$$Component_Description: A description of the component including information about its function.
$$Component_Type: A category describing the purpose of the component. ALLOWED VALUES interconnection:software:hardware:service:physical:process-procedure:plan:guidance:standard:validation:
$$Control_Id_List: A list of textual labels that uniquely identify the controls or statements that the component implements.
$$Rule_Id: A textual label that uniquely identifies a policy (desired state) that can be used to reference it elsewhere in this or other documents.
$$Rule_Description: A description of the policy (desired state) including information about its purpose and scope.
$Parameter_Id: A textual label that uniquely identifies the parameter associated with that policy (desired state) or controls implemented by the policy (desired state).
$Parameter_Description: A description of the parameter including the purpose and use of the parameter.
$Parameter_Value_Alternatives: ONLY for the policy (desired state) parameters: A value or set of values the parameter can take. The catalog parameters values are defined in the catalog.
$Parameter_Value_Default: A value recommended by Compliance Team in this profile for the parameter of the control or policy (desired state). If a CIS-benchmark exists, the default default could be the CIS-benchmark recommanded value.
$$Profile_Source: A URL reference to the source catalog or profile for which this component is implementing controls for. A profile designates a selection and configuration of controls from one or more catalogs
$Check_Id: A textual label that uniquely identifies a check of the policy (desired state) that can be used to reference it elsewhere in this or other documents.
$Check_Description: A description of the check of the policy (desired state) including the method (interview or examine or test) and procedure details.
$$Namespace: A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name. Used in conjunction with "class" as the ontology concept.

$$Rule_Description: GitHub API returns any supported version.
$$Profile_Description: NIST Special Publication 800-53 Revision 5 HIGH IMPACT BASELINE
$Check_Description: Check whether there are any supported versions.

$$Profile_Description: NIST Special Publication 800-53 Revision 5 HIGH IMPACT BASELINE
$Check_Description: Check whether the GitHub org is not empty.

$$Rule_Description: Building images which specify a base as their origin is a good start to improving supply chain security, but over time organizations may want to build an allow list of specific base images which are allowed to be used when constructing containers. This policy ensures that a container's base, found in an OCI annotation, is in a cluster-wide allow list.
$$Profile_Description: NIST Special Publication 800-53 Revision 5 HIGH IMPACT BASELINE
$Check_Description: Building images which specify a base as their origin is a good start to improving supply chain security, but over time organizations may want to build an allow list of specific base images which are allowed to be used when constructing containers. This policy ensures that a container's base, found in an OCI annotation, is in a cluster-wide allow list.

$$Rule_Description: Images coming from certain registries require authentication in order to pull them, and the kubelet uses this information in the form of an imagePullSecret to pull those images on behalf of your Pod. This policy searches for images coming from a registry called `corp.reg.com` and, if found, will mutate the Pod to add an IimagePullSecret called `my-secret`.
$$Profile_Description: NIST Special Publication 800-53 Revision 5 HIGH IMPACT BASELINE
$Check_Description: Adding capabilities beyond those listed in the policy must be disallowed.

$$Rule_Description: Ensure deployment configuration is securely set up
$$Profile_Description: NIST Special Publication 800-53 Revision 5 HIGH IMPACT BASELINE
$Check_Description: Ensure NGINX is deployed and running with given minimum instances

$$Rule_Description: Ensure roles are set to only allowed values
$$Profile_Description: NIST Special Publication 800-53 Revision 5 HIGH IMPACT BASELINE
$Check_Description: Ensure roles are set to only allowed values

$$Rule_Description: Ensure scan is enabled with high level
$$Profile_Description: NIST Special Publication 800-53 Revision 5 HIGH IMPACT BASELINE
$Check_Description: Ensure scan is enabled with high level
